intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. symmetrus, commonly known as the symmetrical buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It is characterized by its bright yellow, saucer-shaped flowers with a distinctive central crown. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm and features basal leaves that are palmately lobed. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for garden cultivation and ecological restoration projects.
